description:
This two-vehicle crash occurred during daylight hours at a three-legged intersection. The
                        north/south roadway was straight, level and undivided with a speed limit of 72 kmph (45 mph).and
                        the east/west roadway is straight, level and undivided with a speed limit of 40 kmph (25 mph).
                        The southbound travel lanes consists of a right turn lane, two through lanes and a left turn
                        lane. The east/west roadway consists of two lanes, one in each direction, with a stop sign
                        controlling the entry to the north/south roadway. There were no adverse weather conditions at
                        the time.


                        Vehicle one, a 2003 Mazda Protege, was eastbound, turning right at the intersection. Vehicle
                        two, a 1995 Jeep Grand Cherokee, was southbound in the right through lane. As vehicle one turned
                        right, the front left was struck by the front of vehicle two. Vehicle one rotated clockwise and
                        vehicle two rotated counterclockwise and the left side of vehicle one struck the right side of
                        vehicle two. Vehicle one came to rest south of the intersection facing northeast. Vehicle two
                        continued to rotate and rolled over four quarter-turns to the right before coming to rest facing
                        northeast. Both vehicles were towed due to damage.


                        The driver of vehicle one, an eighty-two-year-old female, was driving from a financial
                        institution to her home. The vehicle was new to her, but she claimed to be comfortable driving
                        it. She was also quite familiar with the route that she was traveling. She doesn't remember the
                        stop sign, nor does she remember looking left to check for traffic before she made the right
                        turn.


                        The driver of vehicle two, a twenty-nine-year old female, was returning to her office from lunch
                        and had just stopped at a gas station. She was comfortable with the vehicle and the route. She
                        was adjusting the radio just prior to her recognition of an imminent crash, but braked and
                        steered left in an attempt to avoid vehicle one.


                        The critical pre-crash event for vehicle one was coded: this vehicle traveling, turning right at
                        intersection. The critical reason was attributed to vehicle one and was coded as: unknown
                        recognition error.


                        The critical pre-crash event for vehicle two was coded: other motor vehicle encroaching; from
                        crossing street, turning into same direction. The critical reason was not coded to this vehicle.
